Pre-Game Insights: England are currently under pressure in the ODI World Cup 2023, with more losses than wins thus far, which is why they desperately need to get the better of South Africa on October 21.
England versus South Africa is going to be the first match of the ODI World Cup 2023 at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, which puts us in the unknown in regards to how the pitches might play.
England's batting lineup is going to be bolstered immensely by the return of Ben Stokes, after they capitulated against the spin trio of Afghanistan, except for a fine fifty from Harry Brook.
The bowling attack of England had Adil Rashid pick up a bag of wickets against Afghanistan, which is a positive sign for them leading up to their upcoming matches in the ODI World Cup 2023.

South Africa’s batting lineup was neutralised by the highly impressive Netherlands outfit, who had their strategies and execution in complete order during their ODI World Cup 2023 match, despite the enterprising starts from Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller.

The bowlers for South Africa did start the proceedings on a bright note, but they were smashed all over the field by the Netherlands batters, putting up a par total on the board in a rain-curtailed match.

England will have a slight advantage over South Africa in their upcoming ODI World Cup 2023 match at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, owing to a higher number of all-rounders in their probable playing XI.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Although the average first-inning score at this venue in ODIs is 245, the expectation of a total in the range of 280-300 is definitely not out of the question in the upcoming encounter between the Three Lions and the Proteas.
